content:
Is there a reason we don't hide the input box border in dark mode whereas we hide it in the light mode. I really like the light mode design without any bounding box. Would it look odd in dark mode like that? :thinking:

Screenshots for reference: dark light
Add another user text will not be visible in that case.

Hmm, maybe we could use a brighter colour? But I'm unsure if it'll look good. :thinking:

(Has there been any discussion previously about this? Perhaps we resolved the current UI is better considering other options?)

@Dinesh Ch I don't think there's been any recent discussion of it. I have a vague recollection that the box was added when we ported the compose box to support the night theme to work around some problem, but don't recall what.

I do think the inconsistency is a bit weird, but I'm not sure which direction is better. We might want to start with just making the font a little more visible for the "Add another user", and then play with removing the box in the night theme.

Alya Abbott said:

The dark theme is probably more like what we had in mind?

I think the dark theme variant is better, yeah.
This topic was moved here from #feedback > pm recipients input dark vs light mode by Alya Abbott

This question came up again recently (context: #feedback > narrow to topic/pms when composing ). Thoughts?

It looks like Tim Abbott had different intuition in August vs. looking it again today. :)
Yeah, I think ultimately we need to play with things to come to a clear conclusion; it's mostly a visual question and easier to discuss with screenshots than in the abstract.

Sure, it would be helpful to see screenshots/mockups where light mode is styled like dark mode, and/or where dark mode is styled like light mode. We should be thinking about this in conjunction with how to visually indicate #feedback > narrow to topic/pms when composing .
I can get to this once we finish other design decisions
